Title: vagrant up for VSRX, with multi-vm environment
Description:
• uses dhcp + forwarded ports on NAT / host-only private network
  • flow-based forwarding mode (VSRX default), with options to use packet-based mode
  • lack of vmware-tools means less control, but vagrant has shell provisioners, and the VSRX can be modified to support ansible, chef, puppet, etc. (I'm working on hacking BSD either way)
  • started one vsrx, but a whole lab could be brought up with 'vagrant up /vsrx[1-10]/
  • this is just the beginning....
